page.lettertext:
fol.147r
Belgia. 1591 17 May
Belgia: 1591: May.
May it please yo
r
good L. by my letter unto
yow
e 14 of this moneth, I have signified
that
S
r
Francis Vere
was appointed by
e
Coun-
cel of state
, before
e intended siege of
Zut-
phen
or
Deventer
should be undertaken, and
before
e troupes of
e contrey should assemble
in those quarters, to endevo
r
e surprise of
e
fort Zutphen: w
ch
, as we are informed at
this very present, he hath perfourmed very
happely:
wherby both
so by nowe
e contrey is freed
from
e Enemie on this side
e river, and
their other designes are made more easie by
muche, to be atchieved by their forces. What
nombers of souldiers were w
t
in
e fort, and
what losse is sustened of one side or other,
there is nothing certified in particular. Only
this is yet signified
in general wordes
, by
a letter sent in hast, that he tooke it w
t
a
stratageme, by
e meanes of
14
13
souldiers w
ch
were cladde in boores apparel,
and caried
and armor under
themselves so cunningly, that they came into
neath, and w
t
e assistance and c
o
pany of certain
e fort as if they had bin of
e contrey
other boores of
e c
o
trey w
ch
were knowen in the fort for
people and frindes to
e Enemie: whereby
neighbo
rs
and c
o
tributo
rs
, were presently suffered
e assault being geven, at
e same instant by
to
e
ter a port, w
ch
they kept till such time
S
r
Francis Vere
,
he
as S
r
Francis
Vere
w
t
his forces
possessed
e place. Because
this advertisment is newly come, w
t
a present
opportunitie for
e sending of my letter, I would
not omitte to impart it w
t
yo
r
L.
and so
I take my humble leave. From
e Hage.
May 17 1591.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
